Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: vtex
Description: Fig autocomplete for VTEX IO's CLI - VTEX IO's CLI allows you to perform any action necessary to your development process, such as linking local files to the VTEX platform, managing workspaces, and releasing new app versions

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: Adds the specified app(s) to the manifest's dependencies

Arguments.Name: browse
Arguments.Description: Opens the URL relative to your current workspace and account in a new browser window

Arguments.Name: --qr
Arguments.Description: Prints a QR Code on the terminal

Arguments.Name: get
Arguments.Description: Prints the value of the requested configuration key

Arguments.Name: reset
Arguments.Description: Resets the specified configuration to its default value

Arguments.Name: set
Arguments.Description: Sets the value of a configuration key

Arguments.Name: deploy
Arguments.Description: Publishes an app as a stable version. Only works for apps previously published as a release candidate version [see vtex publish --help]

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: (Use with caution.) Ignores the testing period of 7 minutes after publishing an app

Arguments.Name: deprecate
Arguments.Description: Deprecates the specified app, uninstalling and downgrading it to the latest stable version in every VTEX account

Arguments.Name: deps
Arguments.Description: Displays the differences between the dependencies of two distinct workspaces. If a single parameter is passed, the specified workspace's dependencies are compared with the master's. If no parameter is passed, the diff is made between the current workspace and master

Arguments.Name: diff
Arguments.Description: Displays the differences between the dependencies of two distinct workspaces. If a single parameter is passed, the specified workspace's dependencies are compared with the master's. If no parameter is passed, the diff is made between the current workspace and master

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Displays the complete dependency tree of the current workspace

Arguments.Name: --npm
Arguments.Description: Includes dependencies from the npm registry

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Updates a dependency of the current workspace. If not specified which dependency, it updates all of them

Arguments.Name: edition
Arguments.Description: Displays the Edition App version installed on the current account

Arguments.Name: get
Arguments.Description: Displays the Edition App version installed on the current account

Arguments.Name: set
Arguments.Description: Sets the Edition App version for the current account

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Displays help for VTEX CLI commands

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Displays all commands available in the CLI

Arguments.Name: --available
Arguments.Description: Lists services that are available to install

Arguments.Name: --filter=filter
Arguments.Description: Lists services that contain the specified word

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Copies starting files and folders from VTEX boilerplates into your local directories

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Installs an app on the current workspace. If not specified which one, it defaults to the app in the current directory

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Installs the specified app without checking for route conflicts

Arguments.Name: lighthouse
Arguments.Description: Runs a Lighthouse audit over the specified URL

Arguments.Name: audit
Arguments.Description: Runs a Lighthouse audit over the specified URL

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Returns the report as a json on stdout

Arguments.Name: show
Arguments.Description: Shows a previous audit report, filtering by app and/or URL

Arguments.Name: lh
Arguments.Description: Runs a Lighthouse audit over the specified URL

Arguments.Name: audit
Arguments.Description: Runs a Lighthouse audit over the specified URL

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Returns the report as a json on stdout

Arguments.Name: show
Arguments.Description: Shows a previous audit report, filtering by app and/or URL

Arguments.Name: link
Arguments.Description: Syncs the app in the current directory with the development workspace in use

Arguments.Name: --account=account
Arguments.Description: Starts a development session in the specified account. Must be paired with the '--workspace' flag

Arguments.Name: --setup
Arguments.Description: Sets up typing definitions before linking the app [see vtex setup --help]

Arguments.Name: --unsafe
Arguments.Description: Allows linking the app despite Typescript errors

Arguments.Name: --workspace=workspace
Arguments.Description: Starts a development session in the specified workspace. Can be paired with the '--account' flag to switch from the current account and workspace

Arguments.Name: --no-watch
Arguments.Description: Doesn't watch for file changes after the initial link

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Lists the apps installed on the current workspace and account

Arguments.Name: local token
Arguments.Description: Prints the user's auth token and copies it to the clipboard

Arguments.Name: logout
Arguments.Description: Logs out of the current VTEX account

Arguments.Name: logs
Arguments.Description: Shows logs of an app. (Only apps in production.)

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Shows logs of every app installed on the current account

Arguments.Name: --past
Arguments.Description: Shows previous logs of the specified app

Arguments.Name: publish
Arguments.Description: Publishes the app in the current directory as a release candidate version

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Publishes the app independently of SemVer rules

Arguments.Name: --tag=tag
Arguments.Description: Adds the specified tag to the release

Arguments.Name: --workspace=workspace
Arguments.Description: Uses the specified workspace in the app registry

Arguments.Name: redirects
Arguments.Description: Redirects from the current account and workspace

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Deletes redirects from the current account and workspace

Arguments.Name: export
Arguments.Description: Exports all redirects defined in the current account and workspace to a CSV file

Arguments.Name: import
Arguments.Description: Imports redirects from a CSV file to the current account and workspace

Arguments.Name: release
Arguments.Description: (Only for git users.) Bumps the app version, commits, and pushes to remote the app in the current directory

Arguments.Name: set
Arguments.Description: Sets value to the specified setting of an app

Arguments.Name: unset
Arguments.Description: Disables the specified setting of an app

Arguments.Name: setup
Arguments.Description: Sets up typings and tools for the current development environment

Arguments.Name: --ignore-linked
Arguments.Description: Sets up types from published apps, and ignores types from linked apps

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Sets up all available typings, configs, and tools

Arguments.Name: --tooling
Arguments.Description: Sets up Prettier, Husky, and ESLint

Arguments.Name: --tsconfig
Arguments.Description: Sets up React and Node TSconfig, if applicable

Arguments.Name: --typings
Arguments.Description: Sets up GraphQL and React typings

Arguments.Name: submit
Arguments.Description: Submits the current app, or an specified one, to validation from VTEX App Store team

Arguments.Name: support
Arguments.Description: Logs in as support to another VTEX account

Arguments.Name: test
Arguments.Description: Runs unit tests for the app in the current directory

Arguments.Name: e2e
Arguments.Description: Runs E2E integration tests for the app in the current directory

Arguments.Name: --report=report
Arguments.Description: Displays the results and state of the specified test ID

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: (Not recommended.) Sends your personal authorization token to your testing session, making it available during the tests. It can be dangerous since it exposes your token via the 'authToken' environment variable

Arguments.Name: --workspace
Arguments.Description: Runs tests for the apps installed on the specified workspace

Arguments.Name: unit
Arguments.Description: Runs unit tests for the app in the current directory

Arguments.Name: undeprecate
Arguments.Description: Reestablishes a deprecated version of an app as a stable version

Arguments.Name: uninstall
Arguments.Description: Uninstalls an app from the current workspace. If not specified which app to uninstall, it defaults to the app in the current directory

Arguments.Name: unlink
Arguments.Description: Unlinks an app from the current workspace. If not specified which app to unlink, it defaults to the app in the current directory

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Updates all installed apps to the latest (minor or patch) version. Does not upgrade to another major version

Arguments.Name: url
Arguments.Description: Prints base URL for the current account and workspace

Arguments.Name: whoami
Arguments.Description: Prints the current account, workspace, environment, and login details

Arguments.Name: abtest
Arguments.Description: A/B tests from running on the current account

Arguments.Name: finish
Arguments.Description: Stops all A/B tests from running on the current account

Arguments.Name: start
Arguments.Description: Starts a new A/B test on the current workspace

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Displays the results of the active A/B tests

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Deletes one or many workspaces from the current account

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Deletes the specified workspace even if it is currently in use

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Lists all workspaces of the current account

Arguments.Name: promote
Arguments.Description: Promotes the current workspace to master. Only works for production workspaces

Arguments.Name: reset
Arguments.Description: Cleans all configurations of the specified workspace and recreates it with the configurations from master

Arguments.Name: --production
Arguments.Description: Recreates the workspace as a production one

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Displays information about the specified workspace

Arguments.Name: use
Arguments.Description: Creates and switches to a new workspace or simply switches to an existing one

Arguments.Name: --production
Arguments.Description: Creates and/or switches to a production workspace

Arguments.Name: --reset
Arguments.Description: Resets the workspace before switching to it
